page.title: 01LITTLE STAUGHTON
page.content: Little Staughton is a parish and village in Bedfordshire, bordering Cambridgeshire. It is a residential and{farming}community with population in 1981 of 392. Its most prominent ancient building is the 14th century {church.}Beyond the church building lies the site of a moated manor. Other public buildings are the {Baptist Church, the Village Hall and {the "Crown"public house.}There is a small industrial estate on the site of the wartime airfield.There are some ancient domestic and farm buildings but the predominant feature is modern housing.There is a{garage and shop & {Post Office.} The soil is mixed subsoil clay and gravel.The chief crops are wheat,barley,oats and oilseed rape.The Block also includes the small part of the village of {Keysoe.
